p: Aucubin ( 43) is a low-toxic compound in mice. In addition, an impressive variety of pharmacological effects, including antioxidant, anti-aging, anti-inflammatory, anti-algesic, antifibrotic, anti-tumor, hepatoprotective, neuroprotective and osteoprotective properties, and the promotion of dermal wound healing, have been reported for this compound [ 92, 93, 94]. Especially potent are the antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activities determined for aucubin [ 93]. Due to these biological properties, aucubin is receiving increasing attention by pharmacologists [ 93]. Concerning the biological properties of ajugol ( 42), a moderate anti-microbial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Candida spp. has been reported [ 95].
